translations.Failed to delete the server configuratio: Failed to delete the server configuration
translations.The configuration is valid and the conne: The configuration is valid and the connection could be established!
translations.The configuration is valid, but the Bind: The configuration is valid, but the Bind failed. Please check the server settings and credentials.
translations.The configuration is invalid. Please hav: The configuration is invalid. Please have a look at the logs for further details.
translations.Take over settings from recent server co: Take over settings from recent server configuration?
translations.Do you really want to delete the current: Do you really want to delete the current Server Configuration?
translations.Could not detect user display name attri: Could not detect user display name attribute. Please specify it yourself in advanced ldap settings.
translations.Could not find the desired feature: Could not find the desired feature
translations.Groups meeting these criteria are availa: Groups meeting these criteria are available in %s:
translations.The filter specifies which LDAP groups s: The filter specifies which LDAP groups shall have access to the %s instance.
translations.Defines the filter to apply, when login: Defines the filter to apply, when login is attempted. %%uid replaces the username in the login action. Example: "uid=%%uid"
translations.You can omit the protocol, except you re: You can omit the protocol, except you require SSL. Then start with ldaps://
translations.The DN of the client user with which the: The DN of the client user with which the bind shall be done, e.g. uid=agent,dc=example,dc=com. For anonymous access, leave DN and Password empty.
translations.For anonymous access, leave DN and Passw: For anonymous access, leave DN and Password empty.
translations.You can specify Base DN for users and gr: You can specify Base DN for users and groups in the Advanced tab
translations.Avoids automatic LDAP requests. Better f: Avoids automatic LDAP requests. Better for bigger setups, but requires some LDAP knowledge.
translations.Manually enter LDAP filters (recommended: Manually enter LDAP filters (recommended for large directories)
translations.Limit %s access to users meeting these c: Limit %s access to users meeting these criteria:
translations.The filter specifies which LDAP users sh: The filter specifies which LDAP users shall have access to the %s instance.
translations.<b>Warning:</b> Apps user_ldap and user_: Warning: Apps user_ldap and user_webdavauth are incompatible. You may experience unexpected behavior. Please ask your system administrator to disable one of them.
translations.<b>Warning:</b> The PHP LDAP module is n: Warning: The PHP LDAP module is not installed, the backend will not work. Please ask your system administrator to install it.
translations.When unchecked, this configuration will: When unchecked, this configuration will be skipped.
translations.Give an optional backup host. It must be: Give an optional backup host. It must be a replica of the main LDAP/AD server.
Only connect to the replica server.
translations.Not recommended, use it for testing only: Not recommended, use it for testing only! If connection only works with this option, import the LDAP server's SSL certificate in your %s server.
in seconds. A change empties the cache.
translations.The LDAP attribute to use to generate th: The LDAP attribute to use to generate the user's display name.
translations.One User Base DN per line: One User Base DN per line
translations.The LDAP attribute to use to generate th: The LDAP attribute to use to generate the group's display name.
translations.One Group Base DN per line: One Group Base DN per line
translations.When switched on, groups that contain gr: When switched on, groups that contain groups are supported. (Only works if the group member attribute contains DNs.)
translations.Chunksize used for paged LDAP searches t: Chunksize used for paged LDAP searches that may return bulky results like user or group enumeration. (Setting it 0 disables paged LDAP searches in those situations.)
translations.Leave empty for user name (default). Oth: Leave empty for user name (default). Otherwise, specify an LDAP/AD attribute.
translations.By default the internal username will be: By default the internal username will be created from the UUID attribute. It makes sure that the username is unique and characters do not need to be converted. The internal username has the restriction that only these characters are allowed: [ a-zA-Z0-9_.@- ].  Other characters are replaced with their ASCII correspondence or simply omitted. On collisions a number will be added/increased. The internal username is used to identify a user internally. It is also the default name for the user home folder. It is also a part of remote URLs, for instance for all *DAV services. With this setting, the default behavior can be overridden. To achieve a similar behaviour as before ownCloud 5 enter the user display name attribute in the following field. Leave it empty for default behaviour. Changes will have effect only on newly mapped (added) LDAP users.
translations.By default, the UUID attribute is automa: By default, the UUID attribute is automatically detected. The UUID attribute is used to unambiguously identify LDAP users and groups. Also, the internal username will be created based on the UUID, if not specified otherwise above. You can override the setting and pass an attribute of your choice. You must make sure that the attribute of your choice can be fetched for both users and groups and it is unique. Leave it empty for default behaviour. Changes will have effect only on newly mapped (added) LDAP users and groups.
translations.Usernames are used to store and assign (: Usernames are used to store and assign (meta) data. In order to precisely identify and recognise users, each LDAP user will have a internal username. This requires a mapping from username to LDAP user. The created username is mapped to the UUID of the LDAP user. Additionally the DN is cached as well to reduce LDAP interaction, but it is not used for identification. If the DN changes, the changes will be found. The internal username is used all over. Clearing the mappings will have leftovers everywhere. Clearing the mappings is not configuration sensitive, it affects all LDAP configurations! Never clear the mappings in a production environment, only in a testing or experimental stage.
